q: veteran who had served as CEO of Novell and chief technology officer of Sun Microsystems, Eric Schmidt was brought in to provide some "adult supervision." On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. "I believe Larry is ready" to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. "It's time for him to have a shot at running this."

US businesses' fears range from outright piracy of their goods to the transfer of technological know-how that can be inevitable in joint ventures with Chinese companies. Sometimes Beijing mandates that foreign firms share technology, locate R&D in China and so forth, and the U.S. business community sees that as tying their hands when they go to China, said Kevin Gallagher , professor of international relations at Boston University. "They say, "We"ll do that for five years and then all of a sudden China will have its own competitor that looks just like us

the command of George H.W. Bush 's son, President Bush . Another view on war's end The journal Foreign Policy also questions whether the war truly was successful. Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam Hussein had been chastened, the George H.W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam Hussein 's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama Bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H.W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H.W. Bush at a symposium last week to discuss the war

"The one thing most Hoosiers would say they don't want in Indianapolis at the Statehouse is Washington politics," Parker said. He's used to the Washington game of lay blame and be partisan. He's going to have a hard time making the transition I believe. It might be May or later before Mike Pence would formally jump into the governor's face since state law prohibits political fundraising by statewide candidates until after the Legislature's session ends in late April.
